Quantum Computing

  1. [ ] Aharonov, D., Ta-Shma, A., Vazirani, U., & Yao, A. C. Quantum Bit Escrow.
  2. [ ] Ambainis, A., Schulman, L. J., & Vazirani, U. Computing with Highly Mixed States.
  3. [ ] Bennett, C. H., Bernstein, E., Brassard, G., & Vazirani, U. Strengths and Weaknesses of Quantum Computing.
  4. [ ] McKay, D., Sheldon, S., Smolin, J. A., Chow, J. M., & Gambetta, J. M. Three Qubit Randomized Benchmarking.
  5. [ X ] Aaronson, S. (2013). Quantum Computing Since Democritus.
  6. [ ] Aaronson, S. J. (2000). Limits on Efficient Computation in the Physical World.
  7. [ ] Vidick, T. (2011). The Complexity of Entangled Games.
  8. [ ] Bacon, D. M. (1997). Decoherence, Control, and Symmetry in Quantum Computers.
  9. [ ] Rigetti, C. (2006). Quantum Gates for Superconducting Qubits.

Quantum Algorithms

  1. [ X ] Jordan, S. P. (2005). Fast Quantum Algorithm for Numerical Gradient Estimation.
  2. [ X ] Grover, L., & Rudolph, T. (2002). Creating superpositions that correspond to efficiently integrable probability distributions.

Quantum Control

  1. [ ] Caneva, T., Calarco, T., & Montangero, S. (2011). Chopped Random Basis Quantum Optimization.
  2. [ ] Machnes, S., Tannor, D. J., Wilhelm, F. K., & Ass√©mat, E. (2015). Gradient Optimization of Analytic Controls: The Route to High Accuracy Quantum Optimal Control.
  3. [ ] Kimmel, S., Low, G. H., & Yoder, T. J. (2015). Robust Calibration of a Universal Single-Qubit Gate-Set via Robust Phase Estimation.
  4. [ ] Ferrie, C., & Moussa, O. (2015). Robust and Efficient in situ Quantum Control.
  5. [ ] Khaneja, N., Reiss, T., Kehlet, C., Schlute-Herbruggen, T., & Glaser, S. J. (2005). Optimal Control of Coupled Spin Dynamics: Design of NMR Pulse Sequences by Gradient Ascent Algorithms.
  6. [ ] Motzoi, F., Gambetta, J., Rebentrost, P., & Wilhelm, F. (2009). Simple Pulses for Elimination of Leakage in Weakly Nonlinear Qubits.
